content:
Let MMM be a monoid, NMNMNM its simplicial nerve and A=Sub(NM)A = \mathsf{Sub}(NM)A=Sub(NM) its heyting algebra of subobjects.

For X,Y∈AX, Y \in AX,Y∈A we can define an N\mathbb{N}N-indexed set (X∗Y)n=⋃{x∗y∣x∈Xi,y∈Yj,i+j=n}(X * Y)_n = \bigcup \{ x * y \mid x \in X_i, y \in Y_j, i + j = n \} (X∗Y)n​=⋃{x∗y∣x∈Xi​,y∈Yj​,i+j=n} where x∗y⊆Mnx * y \subseteq M^n x∗y⊆Mn is the set of shuffles of xxx and yyy.

We can then define X∣Y:=cl(X∗Y)X \mid Y := \mathsf{cl}(X * Y)X∣Y:=cl(X∗Y) where cl(Z)∈A\mathsf{cl}(Z) \in Acl(Z)∈A is the smallest simplicial subset such that Zn⊆cl(Z)nZ_n \subseteq \mathsf{cl}(Z)_n Zn​⊆cl(Z)n​ in AAA (well-defined since AAA is a complete lattice).

On the other hand, the maximal nondegenerate dimensional nnn-cells of the cartesian product X×YX \times YX×Y can be identified with the set of shuffles ⋃{x∗y∣x∈Xi,y∈Yj,i+j=n} \bigcup \{ x * y \mid x \in X_i, y \in Y_j, i + j = n \} ⋃{x∗y∣x∈Xi​,y∈Yj​,i+j=n}

Vague question: can X∣YX \mid YX∣Y be described constructively in terms of X×YX \times YX×Y rather than by the closure operation cl\mathsf{cl}cl?

Is it the image of the composite of the left-hand maps in below? (Where x,yx, yx,y are the inclusion maps,
q:M∨M→M×Mq : M \vee M \to M \times Mq:M∨M→M×M is the quotient map from the free product of MMM with itself to the cartesian product, and π:M∨M→M\pi : M \vee M \to Mπ:M∨M→M is the projection.) image.png

Nasos Evangelou-Oost said:

Let MMM be a monoid, NMNMNM its simplicial nerve and A=Sub(NM)A = \mathsf{Sub}(NM)A=Sub(NM) its heyting algebra of subobjects.

Subobjects in the category of simplicial sets, presumably?

For X,Y∈AX, Y \in AX,Y∈A we can define an N\mathbb{N}N-indexed set (X∗Y)n=⋃{x∗y∣x∈Xi,y∈Yj,i+j=n}(X * Y)_n = \bigcup \{ x * y \mid x \in X_i, y \in Y_j, i + j = n \} (X∗Y)n​=⋃{x∗y∣x∈Xi​,y∈Yj​,i+j=n} where x∗y⊆Mnx * y \subseteq M^n x∗y⊆Mn is the set of shuffles of xxx and yyy.

What's a shuffle?

We can then define X∣Y:=cl(X∗Y)X \mid Y := \mathsf{cl}(X * Y)X∣Y:=cl(X∗Y) where cl(Z)∈A\mathsf{cl}(Z) \in Acl(Z)∈A is the smallest simplicial subset such that Zn⊆cl(Z)nZ_n \subseteq \mathsf{cl}(Z)_n Zn​⊆cl(Z)n​ in AAA (well-defined since AAA is a complete lattice).

If I understand this correctly, you're saying (X∗Y)n(X*Y)_n(X∗Y)n​ is a subset of (NM)n(NM)_n(NM)n​ for each nnn, and you're asking for the simplicial subset of NMNMNM generated by the elements of these subsets?

Morgan Rogers (he/him) said:
"Subobjects in the category of simplicial sets, presumably?"

Yes

"What's a shuffle?"

I mean a shuffle product kind of as in https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shuffle_algebra#Shuffle_product , but with a union of words rather than a formal sum. Sorry I'm not sure how to define it concisely, but do you see what I mean?

"If I understand this correctly, you're saying (X∗Y)n(X*Y)_n(X∗Y)n​ is a subset of (NM)n(NM)_n(NM)n​ for each nnn, and you're asking for the simplicial subset of NMNMNM generated by the elements of these subsets?"

Yes
